import Avatar from "./Avatar";
import { Meta, Story, Canvas } from "@storybook/addon-docs/blocks";

<Meta title="Media/Avatar" component={Avatar} />

Avatars provide a visual representation of a user or team through an image, initials, or both (with initials as a fallback).

#### User type

A user is visually represented by a circle shape.
It can be an image, initials, or both.

##### Image

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Image">
		<Avatar
			src="https://getflywheel.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/flyheadshots-4-copy.jpg"
			type="user"
		/>
	</Story>
</Canvas>

##### Initials

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Initials">
		<Avatar initials="ms" type="user" />
	</Story>
</Canvas>

##### Image with initials Fallback

If both an image `src` and the `initials` props are set, they will work together with the image appearing once loaded and the initials appearing prior to load on upon an error.

_Note: These two elements should never appear at the same time._

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Initials Fallback">
		<Avatar
			src="https://getflywheel.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/flyheadshots-4-copy.jpg"
			initials="ms"
			type="user"
		/>
	</Story>
</Canvas>

#### Team type

A team is visually represented by a rounded square shape.
It can be an image, initials, or both.

##### Image

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Team Image">
		<Avatar
			src="https://avatars2.githubusercontent.com/u/2371558?s=400&v=4"
			type="team"
		/>
	</Story>
</Canvas>

#### Background colors

Avatars with initials have a background color.
By default, the background is set to Flywheel's primary brand color (blue).

In addition, the following colors are available:

##### Green

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Color - Green">
		<Avatar color="green" initials="GR" type="user" />
	</Story>
</Canvas>

##### Yellow

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Color - Yellow">
		<Avatar color="yellow" initials="YE" type="user" />
	</Story>
</Canvas>

##### Orange

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Color - Orange">
		<Avatar color="orange" initials="OR" type="user" />
	</Story>
</Canvas>

##### Red

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Color - Red">
		<Avatar color="red" initials="RE" type="user" />
	</Story>
</Canvas>

##### Pink

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Color - Pink">
		<Avatar color="pink" initials="PI" type="user" />
	</Story>
</Canvas>

##### Purple

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Color - Purple">
		<Avatar color="purple" initials="PU" type="user" />
	</Story>
</Canvas>

#### Sizes

There are three built-in sizes for avatars. The default is medium and there's also a small version.

##### Small

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Size - Small">
		<Avatar initials="AZ" size="s" type="user" />
	</Story>
</Canvas>

##### Medium

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Size - Medium">
		<Avatar initials="AZ" size="m" type="user" />
	</Story>
</Canvas>

##### Large

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Size - Large">
		<Avatar initials="AZ" size="l" type="user" />
	</Story>
</Canvas>

#### More on images

When using an image without initials, any load error will result in a blank area.

##### onError

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Error">
		<Avatar src="//bad-path.png" type="team" />
	</Story>
</Canvas>

##### placeholder

You can also have a placeholder image.
This is most valuable when a cached image is immediately available as a placeholder while a large or external image load as the primary `src`.

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Placeholder">
		<Avatar
			placeholderSrc="data:image/jpeg;base64,"
			src={`https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/spaceimages/images/largesize/PIA13014_hires.jpg?${Math.random()}`}
			type="team"
		/>
	</Story>
</Canvas>

##### placeholder with src onError

<Canvas>
	<Story name="Placeholder - With Error">
		<Avatar
			placeholderSrc="data:image/jpeg;base64,"
			src="//bad-path.png"
			type="team"
		/>
	</Story>
</Canvas>
